Primary Definition.quote: "Whenever righteousness declines, I manifest Myself." (Bhagavad Gita 4:7)

Forms.quote: "I am manifest in various forms, yet remain the unchanging One." (Bhagavad Gita 4:6)

Purpose.quote: "For the protection of the good, for the destruction of evil, and for the establishment of righteousness." (Bhagavad Gita 4:8)

Cycles.quote: "In every age I come back to deliver the holy, to destroy the sin of the sinner." (Bhagavad Gita 4:8)

Levels.quote: "From the partial to the complete, from the finite to the infinite." (Sri Aurobindo, The Life Divine)

Signs.quote: "There will be signs in the sun, moon and stars." (Luke 21:25)

Presence.quote: "I am with you always, even unto the end of the world." (Matthew 28:20)

Vehicles.quote: "The Word became flesh and dwelt among us." (John 1:14)

Times.quote: "There is an appointed time for everything." (Ecclesiastes 3:1)

Places.quote: "The whole earth is full of His glory." (Isaiah 6:3)

Effects.quote: "They were transformed by the renewing of their minds." (Romans 12:2)

Conditions.quote: "Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God." (Matthew 5:8)

Patterns.quote: "As above, so below." (Hermes Trismegistus, Emerald Tablet)

Stages.quote: "First the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear." (Mark 4:28)

Response.quote: "Here I am! I stand at the door and knock." (Revelation 3:20)

Nature.quote: "The invisible things of him are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made." (Romans 1:20)

Experience.quote: "Taste and see that the Lord is good." (Psalm 34:8)

Results.quote: "Old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new." (2 Corinthians 5:17)
